thread.title: Man killed in St. Louis apartment building was bystander to domestic dispute, police say
thread.title_full: Man killed in St. Louis apartment building was bystander to domestic dispute, police say

author: From staff reports
title: Man killed in St. Louis apartment building was bystander to domestic dispute, police say
text:
Man killed in St. Louis apartment building was bystander to domestic dispute, police say From staff reports 6 hrs ago ( … ) 
ST. LOUIS • A man shot to death in an apartment building hallway Saturday was apparently an unintended victim when a shot was fired during a domestic quarrel, police say. 
Donald Marks, 33, was shot about 2:40 p.m. in an apartment building in the 3400 block of Goodfellow Boulevard, police said. The address is in the Wells-Goodfellow neighborhood 
The incident began as a domestic dispute between a man, 55, and a female inside an apartmant. That man was assaulted by a second man, 33, during the dispute. 
The 55-year-old man got a gun and fired a shot, which hit Marks as he stood in the hallway outside the door of the apartment. Authorities said he was not involved in the domestic quarrel but was an acquaintance of the younger man involved in the dispute. 
Marks was pronounced dead at the scene. 
The 55-year-old man was arrested and police sought warrants, but prosecutors declined to issue them pending further investigation. The other man involved in the dispute fled and was being sought by police for questioning. 
Marks lived in the 5600 block of Delmar Boulevard, police said.
